name: the one where Ricardo wants to register multiple pets using the Web application
scenarioId: classpath:features/pets/pets_management:the one where Ricardo wants to register multiple pets using the Web application
methodName: the one where Ricardo wants to register multiple pets using the Web application

testSteps.description:
Given Ricardo has registered the following owner in the system
| firstName | lastName | address | city | phone |
| Chris | Brown | oudezijds-voorburgwal 123 | Amsterdam | 0612345638 |

When he registers the following pets for Chris Brown using the Web application
| name | birthDate | type |
| Nala | 02-15-2016 | cat |
| Nagini | 01-05-2019 | snake |
| coco | 06-01-2000 | lizard |

children.description: Ricardo registers a new Pet for Chris Brown using the web form
Ricardo navigates to the add new pet page for Chris Brown
Ricardo navigates to Chris Brown information page
Ricardo navigates to the all owners page
Ricardo navigates to the welcome page
Ricardo opens the browser at http://localhost:32769

rootCause.message:
After several attempts, could not instantiate new WebDriver instance of type class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver (Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.) 
Host info: host: 'fv-az1040-960', ip: '10.1.0.143'
Build info: version: '4.23.1', revision: '656257d8e9'
System info: os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '6.5.0-1025-azure', java.version: '21.0.4'
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
Command: [null, newSession {capabilities=[Capabilities {acceptInsecureCerts: true, browserName: chrome, goog:chromeOptions: {args: [no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, remote-allow-origins=*], binary: /usr/bin/google-chrome, excludeSwitches: [enable-automation, disable-popup-blocking], extensions: []}}]}]). See below for more details.

Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.)

Build info: version: '4.23.1', revision: '656257d8e9'
System info: os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '6.5.0-1025-azure', java.version: '21.0.4'

children.description: Ricardo clicks on the Owners menu
Ricardo enters 'Nala' into the 'name' input field
Ricardo enters '02-15-2016' into the birth date field
Ricardo selects cat on the type dropdown
Ricardo clicks on 'Submit' button
Ricardo registers a new Pet for Chris Brown using the web form
Ricardo navigates to the add new pet page for Chris Brown
Ricardo navigates to Chris Brown information page
Ricardo enters 'Nagini' into the 'name' input field
Ricardo enters '01-05-2019' into the birth date field
Ricardo selects snake on the type dropdown
Ricardo clicks on 'Submit' button
Ricardo registers a new Pet for Chris Brown using the web form
Ricardo navigates to the add new pet page for Chris Brown
Ricardo navigates to Chris Brown information page
Ricardo enters 'coco' into the 'name' input field
Ricardo enters '06-01-2000' into the birth date field
Ricardo selects lizard on the type dropdown
Ricardo clicks on 'Submit' button
Then the pets  should be displayed in the owner information page
For Ricardo: Then the displayed pets and visits information should contain the information of  coco, Nagini, Nala

userStory.storyName: The Pet Clinic should allow to manage the pets information
userStory.displayName: The Pet Clinic should allow to manage the pets information
userStory.narrative:
As a VetClinic Manager
  I would like to be able to manage the pets information
  In order to be able to add new pets to owners registered in the system
  Or edit the information of the pets

title: the one where Ricardo wants to register multiple pets using the Web application

rule.name: The system should allow to register a new pet in the system
rule.description: Web form uses the following format for the birthDate: MM-dd-yyyy

testFailureCause.message:
The following 2 assertions failed:
1) Could not instantiate class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
2) Expected: iterable with items [<PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=coco, birthDate=2000-06-01, type=lizard], visitInformationList=[]]>, <PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=Nagini, birthDate=2019-01-05, type=snake], visitInformationList=[]]>, <PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=Nala, birthDate=2016-02-15, type=cat], visitInformationList=[]]>] in any order
     but: no item matches: <PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=coco, birthDate=2000-06-01, type=lizard], visitInformationList=[]]>, <PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=Nagini, birthDate=2019-01-05, type=snake], visitInformationList=[]]>, <PetsAndVisitsInformation[petInformation=PetInformation[name=Nala, birthDate=2016-02-15, type=cat], visitInformationList=[]]> in []
